description: From post-classical Latin pyrexia, from Ancient Greek πυρεξία (purexía, “feverishness”), from πυρετός (puretós, “fever”).

nouns.description: pyrexia (countable and uncountable, plural pyrexias or pyrexiae)

examples: The least defined pyrexiae were the continued fevers, divided mainly into typhus, enteric (typhoid) and relapsing.
